title: Disaster as BBC Breakfast host Dan Walker manages to LOSE brand new pound coin
text:
TV Disaster as BBC Breakfast host Dan Walker manages to LOSE brand new pound coin There were blushes galore as Dan Walker disappeared behind the famous red sofa to retrieve the runaway coin Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now BBC Breakfast host manages to LOSE the first new pound coin Share this video Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Never work with children or animals, is the mantra drummed into everyone who works on live TV. 
But it turns out that any inanimate object can be just as tricky to handle - as was proved on this morning's BBC Breakfast show. 
TV host Dan Walker managed to fumble the brand new pound coin while he and Louise Minchin were giving their verdict on it – and his butterfingers ways sent the coin flying behind the famous red sofa. 
"We have a first here," said a sheepish Louise to the camera, while Dan was nowhere to be seen. Louise looked embarrassed as she confessed Dan had lost his coin (Photo: BBC) Her co-host was nowhere in sight (Photo: BBC) 
"I have my pound coin… Dan has actually lost his pound coin – the first pound coin! Down the back of the sofa already," she said. 
Just then, Dan's head popped up behind the sofa looking embarrassed. 
"I went for the first toss of the new pound coin to do a heads or tails thing and it disappeared down here somewhere," he said while searching the area on his hands and knees. There he is! (Photo: PA) Dan was on his hands and knees searching for the pound coin (Photo: PA) Louise struggled not to laugh as her hapless colleague searched the studio (Photo: BBC) 
"Have you found it yet?" laughed his co-host. 
"Er, no," he added. 
Louise scrambled to wrap up the segment in time for the local news and weather – and just as the cameras were panning away, Dan shot his arm up and exclaimed in delight that he had finally found the miscreant coin. Got it! Dan finds the coin just in the knick of time (Photo: PA) 
It's not the first time Dan's presenting has raised eyebrows among viewers. 
Back in October 2016, he was forced to defend his seating position after viewers pointed out that him sitting 'camera left' – on the left of Louise as seen on screen – could denote seniority, despite him having less experience than his co-host. 
He told Daily Mirror's Square Eyes that it was less about that than about the height difference between him and Lou. Dan joined Louise on the red sofa last March 
"When I was camera right in Louise's normal seat…this is going to sound stupid but there is a different bum dip in the sofa," he revealed. 
"The studio is used but lots of different people and most people sit camera left so that part of the cushion is more depressed than the other side, so when I sat to the right it was like Bilbo and Gandalf, it looked ridiculous 'cos I looked huge and she looked quite small." 
BBC Breakfast is on weekdays from 6am on BBC1. Like us on Facebook
